com.github.lucapino.confluence.rest.client.api

Interface ContentClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContentClientImpl

    public interface ContentClient
    Client to receive Content from a confluence server.
    Author:
    Christian Schulze (c.schulze@micromata.de), Martin BÃ¶hmer

    • Method Detail

      • getContentById

        Future<ContentBean> getContentById(String id,
                                   int version,
                                   List<String> expand)
        Get Content by ID
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the content
        version - The Version of the content
        expand - A List of Fields to expand
        Returns:
        A Future with the ContentBean

      • getContent

        Future<ContentResultsBean> getContent(ContentType type,
                                      String spacekey,
                                      String title,
                                      ContentStatus status,
                                      Date postingDay,
                                      List<String> expand,
                                      int start,
                                      int limit)
        Returns a paginated list of Content.
        Parameters:
        type - the content type to return. Default value: page. Valid values: page, blogpost.
        spacekey - the space key to find content under.
        title - the title of the page to find. Required for page type.
        status - list of statuses the content to be found is in. Defaults to current is not specified. If set to 'any', content in 'current' and 'trashed' status will be fetched. Does not support 'historical' status for now.
        postingDay - the posting day of the blog post.
        expand - a comma separated list of properties to expand on the content. Default value: history,space,version.
        start - the start point of the collection to return
        limit - the limit of the number of items to return, this may be restricted by fixed system limits
        Returns:
        A Future with the ContentResultsBean

      • getComment

        Future<CommentResultsBean> getComment(String spacekey,
                                      String pageTitle,
                                      ContentStatus status,
                                      Date postingDay,
                                      List<String> expand,
                                      int start,
                                      int limit)
        Returns a paginated list of Comment.
        Parameters:
        spacekey - the space key to find content under.
        pageTitle - the title of the page under wich find comments.
        status - list of statuses the content to be found is in. Defaults to current is not specified. If set to 'any', content in 'current' and 'trashed' status will be fetched. Does not support 'historical' status for now.
        postingDay - the posting day of the blog post.
        expand - a comma separated list of properties to expand on the content. Default value: history,space,version.
        start - the start point of the collection to return
        limit - the limit of the number of items to return, this may be restricted by fixed system limits
        Returns:
        A Future with the CommentResultsBean

      • createComment

        Future<CommentBean> createComment(CommentBean comment)
        Creates the provided comment.
        Parameters:
        comment - The comment to create.
        Returns:
        A Future with the CommentBean representing the created comment. Use this instance to continue working with the comment.

      • updateComment

        Future<CommentBean> updateComment(CommentBean comment)
        Updates the provided comment.
        Parameters:
        comment - The comment to update.
        Returns:
        A Future with the CommentBean representing the updated comment. Use this instance to continue working with the comment.

      • createContent

        Future<ContentBean> createContent(ContentBean content)
        Creates the provided content.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to create.
        Returns:
        A Future with the ContentBean representing the created content. Use this instance to continue working with the content.

      • updateContent

        Future<ContentBean> updateContent(ContentBean content)
        Updates the provided content.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to update.
        Returns:
        A Future with the ContentBean representing the updated content. Use this instance to continue working with the content.

      • uploadAttachment

        Future<AttachmentBean> uploadAttachment(AttachmentBean attachment,
                                        ContentBean parentContent)
        Uploads the provided attachment to content (page or blogpost).
        Parameters:
        attachment - The attachement to upload.
        parentContent - The content (page or blogpost) to upload the attachment to.
        Returns:
        A Future with the AttachmentBean representing the uploaded attachement. Use this instance to continue working with the attachment.

      • downloadAttachement

        Future<InputStream> downloadAttachement(AttachmentBean attachment)
        Downalds the given attachment.
        Parameters:
        attachment - the attachment to downlad, represented by an AttachmentBean
        Returns:
        InputStream providing the attachment's data.

      • addLabels

        Future<LabelsBean> addLabels(ContentBean content,
                             List<LabelBean> labels)
        Adds a set of labels to a given content.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to add the labels to.
        labels - the label to add, represetned as LabelBeans
        Returns:
        the updated labels as a LabelsBean

      • convertContent

        Future<StorageBean> convertContent(StorageBean storage)
        Convert to storage format a piece of content in wiki format.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage instance to convert.
        Returns:
        the converted storage as a StorageBean
        See Also:
        Confluence Storage Format
